moves.1. d4: Here is a game i played against parker1, which ends in a nice tactical idea from white.
moves.1... d6 2. c4 Nf6 3. Nc3 Nbd7: Odd move. locks in his bishop.
moves.4. Nf3 e6 5. e4: White has a very kings indian style of center here.
moves.5... h6: wants to avoid the pin on g5, but wastes time.
moves.6... b6: another pawn move. white has a nice center and a lead in development
moves.8... c5 9. d5: This gains some space and locks blacks lsb in
moves.9... a6: nother pawn move?? black is seriously behind in development, while white is about the finish development
moves.10. O-O: White castles and connects his rooks finishing development.
moves.10... Qc7 11. a3 Ng4 12. Bd2 Nde5 13. Nx: here i just though that taking was easier than kicking the other knight
moves.14... cxb4 15. Qa4+: Cant play 15.axb4 because it would lose the pawn on c4
moves.15... Kd8: Black commits to not castling which will prove later as a bad choice
moves.16. Qxb4 a5 17. Qa4 Ba6 18. Nb5: only way to defend the c-pawn
moves.20... Nc5 21. Qc2 Qd7: i dont see the purpose of this move
moves.22. Bg4: pinning the pawn to the queen
moves.22... g6 23. f5 Bg7 24. Nc6+ Kc7 25. fxe: Here i had a nice idea. IF 25... fxe6 25.cxe6 Qxc6 26.Rxf7+ and after king moves 27.Rxg7. This appears to leave the pawn on e4 for grabs, but if 27... Nxe4 it would be answered by Bf4 winning a piece.
moves.26. Rxf7+: And my opponent resigns. At minimun hes going to lose his queen or get mated. Hope you enjoyed:)
